noun.description: A collection of formulas or set forms, especially for use in religious ceremonies.
An official list giving details of medicines that may be prescribed.

adjective.description: Relating to or using officially prescribed formulas.

origin: Mid 16th century: the noun from French formulaire or medieval Latin formularius (liber) (book) of formulae, from Latin formula (see formula); the adjective (early 18th century) is directly from formula.
